湯.definition: soup; hot or boiling water; decoction of medicinal herbs; water in which sth has been boiled

湯加里羅.definition: Tongariro, volcanic area on North Island, New Zealand

湯原.definition: Tangyuan county in Kiamusze or Jiamusi city 佳木斯[Jia1 mu4 si1], Heilongjiang

湯原縣.definition: Tangyuan county in Kiamusze or Jiamusi city 佳木斯[Jia1 mu4 si1], Heilongjiang

湯圓.definition: boiled or deep-fried balls of glutinous rice flour, usually eaten during Lantern Festival

湯姆·索亞歷險記.pinyin: Tang1 mu3 · Suo3 ya4 Li4 xian3 Ji4
湯姆·索亞歷險記.definition: Adventures of Tom Sawyer by Mark Twain 馬克·吐溫|马克·吐温[Ma3 ke4 · Tu3 wen1]

湯姆索亞歷險記.pinyin: Tang1 mu3 Suo3 ya4 Li4 xian3 Ji4
湯姆索亞歷險記.definition: Adventures of Tom Sawyer by Mark Twain

湯川.definition: Yukawa (name); YUKAWA Hideki (1907-1988), Japanese theoretical physicist and Nobel laureate

湯川秀樹.definition: YUKAWA Hideki (1907-1988), Japanese theoretical physicist and Nobel laureate

湯料.definition: raw materials for making soup; packaged soup mix

湯武革命.definition: the Tang and Wu Revolts: the overthrow (c. 1600 BC) of the Xia Dynasty by the first king, Tang 商湯|商汤[Shang1 Tang1], of the Shang Dynasty, and the overthrow (c. 1046 BC) of the Shang Dynasty by the Zhou Dynasty founder, King Wu 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2]

湯玉麟.definition: Tang Yulin (1871-1937), minor warlord in northeast China, sometime governor of Chengde 承德, mostly poor in battle but very successful at accumulating personal wealth

湯種.definition: water roux (aka tangzhong), a gelatinous paste made by heating a mixture of flour and water, used in breadmaking to produce a softer, fluffier loaf (loanword from Japanese 湯種 yudane)

湯陰.definition: Tangyin county in Anyang 安陽|安阳[An1 yang2], Henan

湯陰縣.definition: Tangyin county in Anyang 安陽|安阳[An1 yang2], Henan

湯顯祖.definition: Tang Xianzu (1550-1616), Ming poet and dramatist, author of The Peony Pavilion 牡丹亭[Mu3 dan5 Ting2]

湯餅筵.definition: dinner party given on the third day after the birth of a baby (traditional)
